mobs.LongDesc: An old man with a long, white beard, calmly puffs on his pipe
mobs.DetailedDesc:
This is the legendary Sage of Shadowdale, Elminster. The oldest and most
powerful wizard ever to have lived, he was taught magic by Mystra herself over
a millenium ago. His appearance only hints at about 60 of his 1200 years of
age, and his tall, thin frame has held up well to the passing centuries,
thanks to his status as on of Mystra's Chosen. Though he could use his magic
to take over the world, he is wise enough to know that such action would tear
the Realms apart, thus he spends his power in thwarting such schemes made by
others, most notably the Zhentarim, led by their High Lord, Manshoon. In fact,
Elminster can boast of having killed Manshoon more times than anyone else (23
times in fact, due to Manshoon's habit of being brought back to life in
clones). Were it not for the intervention of Elminster, the Realms would have
been destroyed on several occasions.

mobs.LongDesc: The Simbul paces restlessly, awaiting Elminster's return.
mobs.DetailedDesc:
This simbul is the Queen of the eastern nation of Aglarond. She keeps
at bay the forces of the Red Wizards of Thay, almost single-handedly. Her
power in magic is rivalled by only a select few in the Realms. Speaking
of a select few, she is also one of the Seven Sisters (the most powerful
of the Seven), and one of the Chosen of Mystra. She is very fond of
Elminster, since he is one of the few individuals in all the world who
can understand her predicament. She can never truly trust anyone, because
so many people would want to destroy her, and even loyal servants could
be twisted by magic. With Elminster she has someone who is fond of her,
and is well beyond the power of any mortal's magical influence.

mobs.LongDesc: a young woman smiles at you warmly.
mobs.DetailedDesc:
Shandril Shessair is on of very few individuals who wield the power of
Spellfire. Spellfire is the power to absorb energy (most notably magic) and
convert it into raw power, with devestating results. Shandril's power has been
sought by agents of the Zhentarim, the Cult of the Dragon, and several other
powerful individuals. If not for the intervention, of Elminster, the Knights
of Myth Drannor, and the Harpers, she would surely have been either killed or
enslaved. With her newlywed husband Narm, she has crossed half the Realms in
flight from those who would do her harm...so she doesn't have to burn them to
cinders.

mobs.LongDesc: a man dressed in plain mage-robes is standing here.
mobs.DetailedDesc:
Narm is the husband of the spell-fire wielder, Shandril Shessair. Other than
that distinction, there is little of conseqence about Narm. His magic is
powerful enough that he could most likely magick himself out of a paper
bag...if sorely pressed.

mobs.LongDesc: Lord Mourngrym smiles and welcomes you to Shadowdale.
mobs.DetailedDesc:
The Lord of Shadowdale is a not-quite-middle-aged man, originally from
Waterdeep. He was made Lord of the Dale following a tradition that no dalesman
will have rule over another. Instead heroes of the Dale are given the
position, in a semi-democratic vote. As a former member of the Knights of Myth
Drannor, Mourgrym qualified and was willing to take the job. He rules the dale
fairly and justly, and has not let the powqer of his postion make him
high-and-mighty. He is a man of his word, and an all-around nice guy.

mobs.LongDesc: Lady Shaerl waves to you and smiles.
mobs.DetailedDesc:
The Lady of Shadowdale, was first sent to the dale as a spy for the kingdom
of Cormyr. However, she fell in love with the man she was sent to spy on, and
became the Lady of the Dale instead. Though, like Mourngrym, she is
approaching middle age, she remains youthful at heart--a handy trait when the
often-childish Knights of Myth Drannor are always aroud your home.

mobs.LongDesc: Elminster's scribe, Lhaeo, is preparing a meal fit for an archmage.
mobs.DetailedDesc:
Lhaeo is a thin, soft-spoken man, wearing an apron stained with inkspots. He
does the housekeeping for Elminster while he's away (and while he's home too)
and he cooks meals for the sage. In return, Elminster has kept him hidden from
his enemies. Lhaeo is the last of the Royal house of the nation of Tethyr, and
those who seized power would want him dead...if they learned he was even
alive.
   Also, it would have been nearly impossible to spend so much time around
Elminster and not learn any magic, and Lhaeo has learned more than just a
little from the most mighty mage in the Realms.

mobs.LongDesc: Florin Falconhand looks at you and wonders if you are a threat to the dale.
mobs.DetailedDesc:
Florin Falconhand is the leader of the Knights of Myth Drannor (and the most
serious of the bunch). He is a ranger by trade, and the most formiddable of
the Knights in melee combat.

mobs.LongDesc: Merith is here, wondering where Jhessail wandered off to.
mobs.DetailedDesc:
Merith Strongbow is the only elven member of the Knights of Myth Drannor. He
is practiced in both the arts of fighting and of wizardry, making him a
valuable asset to the Knights. One of the more subdued of the Knights,
Merith's playful sense of humor is all the more surprising when he displays
it. his love of Jhessail of the Knights, a human, has made him more
open-minded than most elves.

mobs.LongDesc: Jhessail is here, waiting for Merith.
mobs.DetailedDesc:
Jhessail is the more powerful of the two mages of the Knights of Myth
Drannor. She is in love with the lef, Merith, and since elves live so much
longer than humans, she seeks to extend her lifespan through the use of her
magic. If she can't do that she will die of old age before her elven husband
passes the prime of his youth.

mobs.LongDesc: Illistyl of the Knights is laughing at a joke someone made.
mobs.DetailedDesc:
Illistyl is the youngest of the Knights of Myth Drannor, and a mage. Though
she is technically an apprentice of Jhessail, she is an accomplished
spellcaster in her own right. Onne of the more rowdy of the Knights, she and
her sometimes-lover, Torm, make sure that the Knights' adventures stay
interesting--even if they don't mean to.

mobs.LongDesc: Torm of the Knights smiles slyly, making you suspect he's up to something.
mobs.DetailedDesc:
The most interesting and least moral of the Knights of Myth Drannor, Torm is
a thief by trade. He has given up crime (for the most part) and devoted his
life to tormenting his closest friend in the Knights, Rathan. Torm always has
a witty, and usually ill-considered remark for everything. Combined with his
habit of chasing women, some of them married, it is amazing that he has
managed to live as long as he has--and barring repeated intervention of his
fellow Knights, he wouldn't have.

mobs.LongDesc: Rathan takes a flask from his belt and drinks from it.
mobs.DetailedDesc:
Rathan of the Knights of Myth Drannor is a prist of Tymora, the Godess of
Luck. In her service he takes many rash and reckless actions, and thus he is
the perfect companion for Torm, who throws caution to the wind even without
divine aid. But recklessness is not in Rathan's nature, and so to help him
deal with it, he drinks. To keep himself from getting drunk in the process, he
eats enough for 3 men, and thus has a rather large waistline.

mobs.LongDesc: Lanseril is watching over the people of the dale.
mobs.DetailedDesc:
Lanseril of the Knights of Myth Drannor is a druid. As a powerful agent of
the forest gods, he is able to change into the shape of woodland animals. In
more civilized areas, though, he is more reserved. He rarely speaks, and even
then it is usually only in answer to someone speaking to him. In this way he
is unique among the Knights...he can keep his mouth shut for more than a
minute a t a time.

mobs.LongDesc: Storm Silverhand, Bard of Shadowdale, is working in the fields, hunning.
mobs.DetailedDesc:
Though the bard of Shadowdale appears to be in her early forties, she is
actually only 12 years shy of her 600th birthday. As one of the Chosen of
Mystra, she has seen more and done more than most mortals ever will. She is
among the greatest bards in history, and her swordsmanship is the finest in
all the Dales. Storm is also one of the younger of the Seven Sisters, and a
senior member of the Harpers. One of the duties she has taken upon herself is
to see to the safety of Elminster. Even though he is the most powerful mage in
the world, she knows that he is mortal, and though it always seems that her
help in unnecessary, it may one day save the life of the Sage of Shadowdale.

mobs.LongDesc: a dalesman goes about his business
mobs.DetailedDesc:
The dalesmen are friendly fork, but cautious. Once the realize you can be
trusted, they will extend you their every hospitality. Killing them will _not_
help them trust you any...

mobs.LongDesc: a daleswoman is going about her daily routine
mobs.DetailedDesc:
Woman are treated as equals in the dales. They share in the work and enjoy
the same priviledges as the men, except for the tradition of the dale being
ruled by a "Lord" and not a "Lady." They are also involved in the defense of
the dale, so you might want to think twice about attacking any of them.

mobs.LongDesc: a small child is playing at being a great wizard.
mobs.DetailedDesc:
This little child wants to be a mage some day. Dressed up in a blanket
(robes) and brandishing a stick (wand), you can picture this child's dreams
coming true some day.

mobs.LongDesc: a small child is playing at being a great wizard.
mobs.DetailedDesc:
This little child wants to be a mage some day. Dressed up in a blanket
(robes) and brandishing a stick (wand), you can picture this child's dreams
coming true some day.

mobs.LongDesc: The ghost of a dead witch resides here.
mobs.DetailedDesc:
Sylune, the Witch of Shadowdale, was once one of the Chosen of Mystra, and a
defender of the dale, using her magic along side Elminster. ON one occasion,
in defense of the dale, she fought a dragon, and had to break her Staff of the
Magi to detroy it. The resulting explosion levelled part of the dale,
including her small hut, and destroyed her corporeal form. She now lives in
the house of her sister Storm, where she helps out in any way she is still
capable of.

mobs.LongDesc: Jhael Silvermane welcomes you to the Old Skull inn.
mobs.DetailedDesc:
Jhael Silvermane has lived in Shadowdale all her life, and knows all of the
residents by name. As the innkeeper at the Old Skull, the only inn in
Shadowdale, she is the first to hear almost all the gossip of the dale.

mobs.LongDesc: A hawk-nose man, surrounded by darkness, slouches in a dark throne
mobs.DetailedDesc:
This hawk-nosed man before you seems a weak avatar for the God of Strife.
Don't let this form fool you though, it is only a shadow of his former
mortality, the shape he wore the day that Ao, the overgod, bestowed godhood
upon him. His power is not limited to the physical constraints of this form.
His divine mantles include Lord of the Dead, God of Strife, Lord of Murder,
and God of Deception. If he had but one of these titles, he would be more than
a match for any mortal. Holding all four, he is more than a match for most
gods. Your only hope to save your life-- not to mention your very soul-- is
that he is not as powerful in the realm of mortals.

mobs.LongDesc: A wizard dressed in black stares coldly at you as he begins casting a spell.
mobs.DetailedDesc:
This is Manshoon, High Lord of the Zhentarim and the true ruler of
Zhentil Keep. He is dressed in all black and dark blue, with his face
obscured behind a mask. He is wearing long-sleeved black robes, and
a high-horned cloak. All about him he carries powerful items of magic.
If not for his deadly magical prowess, he would have been "replaced"
by one of his ambitious underlings long ago. But Manshoon has learned
to cheat death. He has found a way to keep clones of himself prepared
to receive his consciousness when he dies, so he can go on living
even after being killed. Now, hundreds of years old, Manshoon has no
fear of death, neither of his own nor inflicting it upon others in the most
horrible fashion.

mobs.LongDesc: A large, red-headed man wearing black platemail looks sternly at you.
mobs.DetailedDesc:
Fzoul Chembryl was once the high priest of Bane, and a man feared by
every man woman and child in Zhentil Keep, expect perhaps Manshoon, who
viewed him as a worthy ally. After the Time of Troubles, when Bane was
dead, Fzoul turned reluctantly to the worship of Cyric. His ceremonial
black platemail which once bore the holy symbol of Bane, now is just
black.
   Even without the full powers of a high priest, Fzoul is still a
formiddable opponent. He is a large man, well trained in battle, and with
years of experience with killing. Don't let the red hair and ringed
moustache fool you. Fzoul is as much a threat now as almost any cleric
in the Realms.

mobs.ShortDesc: a recently animated clone of Manshoon
mobs.LongDesc: A man looking exactly like Manshoon is standing here.
mobs.DetailedDesc:
This exact copy of Manshoon has had the dead mage's mind
transferred to it. For all intents and purposes, it IS Manshoon now. It's
as if he had never died, except that he is still a bit weak.

mobs.LongDesc: A sinister-looking wizard glares at you.
mobs.DetailedDesc:
While Sarhthor may look and act every bit the evil Zhentarim mage,
he secretly holds allegience to the Harpers, an organization devoted
to keeps the Realms safe from the likes of the Zhentilar. He is one of
the only people that High Lord Manshoon has ever really trusted, since
Sarhthor made it clear that he was content to remain Manshoon's
underling. Don't let his loyalties fool you. Sarhthor may have the down-
fall of the Zhentarim at heart, but he is willing to do almost anything to
maintain the false trust of Manshoon.

mobs.LongDesc: An evil-looking man watches you curiously.
mobs.DetailedDesc:
Semmemon is third in command of the Zhentarim, and will likely
never rise above that position. While manshoon values him for the power
of the spells he can wield, he doesn't trust Semmemon at all. Loyalty
isn't a common trait among the Zhentilar, but Semmemon surpasses
almost any of them in duplicity. Were it not for his usefulness, he would
most likely have "disappeared" long ago. Even then, it's only a matter
of time until Manshoon can no longer tolerate him.

mobs.LongDesc: A fat, foppish man grumbles about his "underlings."
mobs.DetailedDesc:
Lord Chess rules Zhentil Keep, if only in name. The real power in the
city is Manshoon, and his beholder allies. However, puppet ruler he may
be, but Chess does hold some power. To keep up appearances, he has
"command" over all the armies of Zhentil Keep, and he is allowed to
attend the meetings of the inner cirlce of the Zhentarim.
   You could hardly ask for a more appropriate slob to set up as a figure-
head, though. Chess has a certain charm about him, and can carry
himself as a ruler should. One would hope so,since he was once a
priest of Leira, godess of deceit. Secretly, Chess continues to worship
the Lady of the Mists, but with the church of Cyric being dominant in
his city, he dares not let that secret out.

mobs.LongDesc: The high-priest of Cyric is performing a dark ritual.
mobs.DetailedDesc:
This wild-eyed lunatic is the high priest of the most evil of gods. He
seems more like a mad-scientist though, judging by the way he acts.
He rants and raves, and talks of revenge for even the most insignificant
of offenses. As Cyric's high priest, he feels that it is his duty to slaughter
every last heretic in the Realms--a heretic being anyone who slights
Cyric in any way, in thought, speech, or action. He proudly wears the
silver bracers that all priests of Cyric wear to show their enslavement
to the darkest of gods.
   For all his apparent insanity, he is more than competant as an
adversary.

mobs.LongDesc: A man in dark purple robes glares at you with contempt.
mobs.DetailedDesc:
Dressed in dark purple robes and a holy symbol depicting a skull in
the middle of a sunburst, this man does not look friendly. You see the
silver bracers on his wrists that mark him as a willing slave to the god
Cyric. Cyrics priests profit from their slavery, however, and their god
gives them considerable power in return for their souls.

mobs.LongDesc: A big thug with a club is looking for sacrifices for the priests.
mobs.DetailedDesc:
This brainless thug was hired by the chruch to scour the back alleys
of Zhentil Keep for victims to use for dark ceremonies. They'll attack
anyone who's not under the protection of the church (and occasionally
those who are). If you look tough, and intimidating, maybe they'll leave
you alone. They may be stupid, but attacking heavily armed adventurers
is possible beyond even their stupidity.

mobs.LongDesc: a feral child cheers and beckons for his friends to chase you.
mobs.DetailedDesc:
This is one of many children in Zhentil Keep who either have no
parents, or have parents who don't care about them. As a result, they
wander the streets in groups, like pack animals, doing as they please, 
and answering to no one.

mobs.LongDesc: A many-eyed floating ball of flesh looks at you, with all it's eyes.
mobs.DetailedDesc:
This is a beholder, a large floating orb of many eyes, dominated by
a large, toothy maw and a large central eye. Each eye other than the
central one is at the end of a writhing eyestalk. When you look into
the bloodshot central eye, you can see only your own impending
death!

mobs.LongDesc: A writhing eystalk swivels around to stare at you.
mobs.DetailedDesc:
This eye eye is on the end of a stalk that is about two feet long. As
you being to ponder the consequences of having an eye out that far
from your body (catching it in doors, etc.) you suddenly realize that if
you don't pay attention, this eye's magical power could destroy you.

mobs.LongDesc: A writhing eystalk swivels around to stare at you.
mobs.DetailedDesc:
This eye eye is on the end of a stalk that is about two feet long. As
you being to ponder the consequences of having an eye out that far
from your body (catching it in doors, etc.) you suddenly realize that if
you don't pay attention, this eye's magical power could destroy you.

mobs.DetailedDesc:

you being to ponder the consequences of having an eye out that far
from your body (catching it in doors, etc.) you suddenly realize that if
you don't pay attention, this eye's magical power could destroy you.

mobs.DetailedDesc:

you being to ponder the consequences of having an eye out that far
from your body (catching it in doors, etc.) you suddenly realize that if
you don't pay attention, this eye's magical power could destroy you.

mobs.DetailedDesc:

you being to ponder the consequences of having an eye out that far
from your body (catching it in doors, etc.) you suddenly realize that if
you don't pay attention, this eye's magical power could destroy you.

from your body (catching it in doors, etc.) you suddenly realize that if

mobs.LongDesc: A writhing eystalk swivels around to stare at you.
mobs.DetailedDesc:
This eye eye is on the end of a stalk that is about two feet long. As
you being to ponder the consequences of having an eye out that far
from your body (catching it in doors, etc.) you suddenly realize that if
you don't pay attention, this eye's magical power could destroy you.

mobs.LongDesc: A Zhentarim soldier partols the area.
mobs.DetailedDesc:
Big, nasty-looking, wearing black plate armor. That about summs up
any Zhentarim warrior you'll ever meet. They're long on brute force, weak
on subtlety, stealth, and brains. Any adventurer worth his salt could
take down half a dozen of them without breaking a sweat.

mobs.LongDesc: A Zhentarim sentry tries to stop you!!
mobs.DetailedDesc:
Their lives depend on nobody getting past them without permission.
From that point of view, you can understnad why they as attack on
sight at the slightest chance of that happening. They're better trained
than the normal Zhent soldiers, and might actually be able to stop you.

mobs.LongDesc: A huge stone golem guards the door.
mobs.DetailedDesc:
Carved from a block of stone, this 20 foot tall guardian might prove
to be a bit tough to move. At least the stupid thing doesn't seem to
mind you being here, as long as you don't try to go through the door
it's guarding.

mobs.LongDesc: A suit of armor stands against one one of the room.
mobs.DetailedDesc:
This suit of armor gives you the creeps. It seems to emit a feeling
of cold and fear. Perhaps this is just an illusion that Manshoon created
to unnerve unwanted guests.
   Heh, if you knew Manshoon, you'd know better than to think he'd
want anything non-lethal guarding him.

mobs.LongDesc: a devious spell-ward is here to stop you however it can.
mobs.DetailedDesc:
A small ward is carved into the floor, designed to kill people who
aren't meant to be here.

mobs.LongDesc: a nasty spell-ward is carved into the floor.
mobs.DetailedDesc:
A small ward is carved into the floor, designed to kill people who
aren't meant to be here.

mobs.LongDesc: a deadly spell-ward is giving off an aura of death.
mobs.DetailedDesc:
A small ward is carved into the floor, designed to kill people who
aren't meant to be here.
